column4: hi! i have a problem with an HarDsik because i surely did something wrong! i changed size of the partitions, i formatted and formatted again, changed FS many times... and now that partition is gone. How can i rescue data from that partition?
when i boot the pc, system tell me that there are some errors that i have to heal manually, mayb to run fsdisk
what error exactly?
the error is: you have some errors in your HD. I'm not joking
id imagine u'll have to reformat, so a clean install would be in order
you dont need windows, if the partition which ha problems is ur one where ubuntu is installed then reinstall it, if not use gparted to re partition that area
i wish to know what stuff is inside the lost partitiion
can you access it at all?
so which one is bad... your swap partition?
try as super user
if u only run linux, why have a FAT32 partition?
i have a fat32 partition because the last year there was installed windows, now i i removed it
well if there is nothing of use on it... then its save to repartition
nihil@Portatile:~$ cd /media/usbdisk/lost+found/
add sudo to the beginning of ur commands
nihil@Portatile:~$ sudo cd /media/usbdisk/lost+found/
are you the only user of this machine?
chmod <add extra commands here>
try "chmod --help" for help on it
done
done... but there's nothing inside that folder!!!!!
was it empty before?
the system told me that inside the volume there were 900mb of stuff.... what's the matter?
no idea, this is probly why its not working ;)
